page.description: The Google map method action calls a method to perform some action on a Google Map. The map could be the Search Part, or in an Alternate View, for example. actions that you can perform include: Clearing markers, opening or closing an info box, adding a marker to the map, centering the map on an address, and setting the map zoom factor.

item.name: Map Id
item.description: Specify the ID of the map you want to operate on. Choices include.

item.name: Action
item.description: Specify the action you want to perform. Choices include.

item.name: Marker types to delete
item.description: Specify which markers to delete. 'All markers' includes the markes that the user placed on the map to mark a search polygon. Choices include *[ui:All markers]*, *[ui:Exclude polygon markers]*.

item.name: Address fields
item.description: Enter a comma delimited list of fields that should be used for the address. You do not need a complete address. For example, you might just specify the 'city' field. You can also enter a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes. The literal value must be properly javascript escaped. e.g. 'Land\s end road'.

item.name: Zoom factor
item.description: 0 shows the whole world; 20 shows a few square yards.

item.name: Open an infobox
item.description: Specify which infobox to open. 'CurrentRow' opens the infobox for the current row. You can also enter an explicit row number. e.g. 3.

item.name: Add marker(s) method
item.description: If you select 'AjaxCallback', you can add multiple markers to the map at once. The location for each marker is computed by an Xbaisc function that you write. If you select 'LocalData' you can add one marker using data that a Javascript function computes. Choices include *[ui:AjaxCallback]*, *[ui:LocalData]*.

item.name: Xbasic function
item.description: Specify the name of the Xbasic function to call. This function will compute the data for each marker you want to place on the map. Click the 'Show function prototype' hyperlink below to see the function prototype of the Xbasic function.

item.name: Method
item.description: If you select 'Simple', then you can fill in prompts for the marker data. If you select 'JavascriptFunction' then you can define a Javascript function that will be called to gather the information necessary to place the marker on the map. Choices include *[ui:Simple]*, *[ui:JavascriptFunction]*.

item.name: Javascript function
item.description: Specify the name of the Javascript function to call. This function will compute the data for the marker you want to place on the map. Click the 'Show function prototype' hyperlink below to see the function prototype of the Javascript function.

item.name: Marker data type
item.description: Specify if the marker location is specified by a latitude and longitude value, or by an address. Choices include *[ui:Latitude/Longitude]*, *[ui:Address]*.

item.name: Latitude
item.description: Specify the latitude. You can specify a field in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Longitude
item.description: Specify the longitude. You can specify a field in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Address
item.description: Specify the address. You can specify a field, or a comma delimited list of fields, in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Title
item.description: Specify the marker title. You can specify a field, or a comma delimited list of fields, in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Infobox
item.description: Specify the text to show in the Infobox. You can specify a field, or a comma delimited list of fields, in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Icon
item.description: (Optional) Specify the icon for the marker. If you leave this blank, a default icon will be used. You can specify a field in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Layer
item.description: (Optional) Specify the 'layer' on which the marker should be placed. Enter any arbitrary string for the layer name. You can specify a field in the current grid row that contains the value, or a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes.

item.name: Animation
item.description: Animation property. Choices include *[ui:None]*, *[ui:Bounce]*, *[ui:Drop]*.

item.name: Animation duration
item.description: Animation duration property.

item.name: Callback function
item.description: Specify the name of the Javascript function to call after the marker has been added. You must define this function in Javascript Function Declarations. The function prototype has a single argument 'm' - the Google Maps 'Marker' object. See 'http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/javascript/reference.html#Marker' for more information.

item.name: Draw circle around marker
item.description: Specify if a circle should be drawn around the marker.

item.name: Radius
item.description: Specify the circle radius. If you do not specify units, 'meters' are assumed. You can use the following units: m, km, mi, y (meters, kilometers, miles, yards). Example: '3mi'. You can read the radius from a field in the current record, or you can specify a literal value by enclosing the value in single quotes. e.g. '10mi'.

item.name: Circle stroke color
item.description: Circle stroke color property.

item.name: Circle stroke opacity
item.description: Circle stroke opacity property.

item.name: Circle stroke weight
item.description: Circle stroke weight property.

item.name: Circle fill color
item.description: Circle fill color property.

item.name: Circle fill opacity
item.description: Circle fill opacity property.

item.name: Layer name
item.description: Specify the name of the layer to show or hide. Marker layers are created by commands that add markers to the map and place then in specific layers. IMPORTANT: Layer names are case sensitive!

item.name: Marker layer to bounce
item.description: Cause the markers on a specific layer to bounce up and down for a specified duration (to draw the user's attention to the markers).

item.name: Duration
item.description: Specify how long the marker(s) should bounce. Enter the value in seconds.

item.name: Marker index
item.description: Specify the index (row number) of the marker that you want to bounce up and down (to draw the user's attention to the marker). Use 'CurrentRow' for the marker for the current Grid row.

item.name: Bounce type
item.description: Specify the animation effect. Choices include *[ui:Bounce]*, *[ui:Drop]*.
